config.question: A high dependency ratio can create stresses for a society, but those stresses vary depending on the age of population. Using Japan as an example of a population with a large number of older citizens and Kenya as an example of a population with a large number of younger citizens, which of the following statements is not likely to be true?

choices.content: Kenya will have high health care costs and the problem of declining population growth.
Kenya will have high infrastructure costs such as those associated with education and will require rapid economic growth to provide jobs to a growing population.
Japan will have high health care costs and a shrinking amount of government revenue (taxes).
Japan may have difficulty finding people to work in some types of jobs and will have to change societal investments from education to health care.
Both countries face the challenge of providing for non-working members of society in economic conditions that are likely to generate less income for investment in society.
